pasta.domain.template

Class Arena

  • java.lang.Object
    • pasta.domain.template.Arena

  • public class Arena
extends java.lang.Object
    Container class for the Arena information.

    String representation: 

    <arena>
        <name>name</name>
        <firstStartDate>yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH-mm-ss</firstStartDate>
        <password>plaintext</password>
        <repeats>PASTATime</repeats>
</arena>
    Password protected arenas are not fully implemented

    File location on disk: $projectLocation$/template/competition/$competitionName$/arenas/$arenaName$

    Since:
    2013-01-21
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Alex Radu

      • isInvalidName

        public boolean isInvalidName()
        Check if the arena has a valid name.

        A valid arena name does not contain: / \ ? % * : | " < > .

        Returns:
        whether the name of the arena is valid.

      • getNextRunDate

        public java.util.Date getNextRunDate()

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(java.lang.String user,
             java.lang.String playerName)
        Add a player to the arena.

        If the arena is an official arena, only 1 player from a username is allowed. The old player is overridden with the current one. If the arena is not official (used for marking), the student is allowed to add as many players as they wish.

        Parameters:
        user - the username of the user adding the player
        playerName - the name of the player the user is adding to the arena
